page.title: 10GRAVEYARD
page.content: Around the church there is a cemetery with 53 gravestones in total. This century there have been 26 gravestones erected. Six of the gravestones have Celtic Crosses on them. The oldest gravestone was put there in 1741 which makes it 244 years old. Before then people were buried under the church itself. One epitaph reads, "Like crowded forest trees we stand But some are marked to fall. The axe that falls at God's command It soon will suit us all." The whole area of the graveyard is 1036 square metres. In and around the gravegard are trees and bushes which help to make it very picturesque. Many people have already reserved their resting place in Glenprosen Churchyard.
